title: 112_hr4373
content: The Act titled "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" provides expanded tax benefits for adoption that are made permanent. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" made expansions enacted in 2001 permanent and reinstated expansions enacted in 2010, including an increase in the dollar limitation for adoption credits. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" permanently increased the dollar limitation for adoption credits to $13,170, with adjustments for inflation beginning after December 31, 2010. The dollar amount for adoption credits was increased by the "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" to $13,170, with adjustments for inflation based on the cost-of-living adjustment for specific calendar years. The dollar amount for adoption credits was increased to $13,170 for calendar year 2001, with adjustments for inflation. The dollar amount for adoption credits was increased to $13,170 for calendar year 2001, with adjustments for inflation. This change also applies to subsections (a)(2) and (b)(1) for taxable years after December 31, 2010. The dollar amount for adoption credits was increased for taxable years after December 31, 2002, based on the cost-of-living adjustment. If the increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. Additionally, the credit was made refundable and moved to a subpart related to refundable credits. The dollar amount for adoption credits was increased for taxable years after December 31, 2002, and if the increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The credit was made refundable and moved to a subpart related to refundable credits in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Section 24(b)(3)(B), 25(e)(1)(C), 25A(i)(5)(B), 25B(g)(2), 26(a)(1), 30(c)(2)(B)(ii), 30B(g)(2)(B)(ii), and 30D(c)(2)(B)(ii) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are all amended by striking references to section 23. Section 30D(c)(2)(B)(ii) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking references to section 23. Additionally, Section 36C and Section 137 of the Code are amended by removing specific subsections and references to section 23, replacing them with references to section 36C. Section 904(i) and Section 1016(a)(26) are also amended by removing references to section 23. Section 36C is amended in various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by replacing references to section 23 with references to section 36C. This includes amendments to sections 904(i), 1016(a)(26), 1400C(d), 6211(b)(4)(A), and the table of sections for subpart A of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1. Additionally, section 1324(b) of title 31, United States Code, is amended by inserting a reference to section 36C. Section 36C is inserted after section 36B in title 31, United States Code, and various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are amended to reference section 36C. Section 36C addresses adoption expenses and its amendments are coordinated with the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years starting after December 31, 2011.
